articles.author: Jillian Kestler-D'Amours
articles.title: Chinese Canadians denounce rising xenophobia tied to coronavirus
articles.description: Chinese Canadians say they are already facing a repeat of the racism they experienced during the SARS outbreak.
articles.content:
Montreal, Canada - Frank Ye still remembers being rejected on the playground when he was six years old.
The now 23-year-old had moved to Canada a year earlier from China, and he was starting school in the Toronto area at the height of the severe acute respir… [+7503 chars]

articles.title: Is the response to the coronavirus enough?
articles.description: As the virus spreads around the world, countries are banning travel and closing their borders to contain the outbreak.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: The racist angle behind China coronavirus epidemic
articles.description: The coronavirus outbreak has led to complaints about a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment around the world.
articles.content:
The World Health Organization (WHO) says it does not recommend trade and travel restrictions in the wake of the new coronavirus outbreak.
But that has not stopped at least 22 countries from imposing some form of travel restrictions on people coming from Chin… [+785 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Coronavirus: Scores of Arab students evacuated from China's Wuhan
articles.description: Jordanian student among 71 Arabs evacuated from Wuhan says he escaped from 'jaws of death'.
articles.content:
Seventy-one Arab students have been evacuated from China's Wuhan, a city at the epicentre of a fast-spreading coronavirus that has killed 300 people and infected more than 14,000 people.
The 71 Arab students evacuated from the central Chinese city flew into … [+3044 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Dispelling the myths around the new coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Spread of new type of coronavirus from China accompanied by misinformation and fake claims online.
articles.content:
A new coronavirus outbreak that is thought to have originated in China's central city of Wuhan has spread to two dozen countries across the globe, infecting more than 14,000 people and killing over 300 people.
All but one of the deaths from the virus have oc… [+2353 chars]

articles.author: Shawn Yuan
articles.title: Local Red Cross under fire over China coronavirus donation mess
articles.description: Public has sent medical supplies and money to help Hubei's front-line medics, but most remains in Red Cross warehouse.
articles.content: Chongqing, China - The Wuhan Red Cross and Hubei provincial Red Cross have come under fire after donations of crucial medical supplies from across China failed to arrive at the hospitals on the front lines of a coronavirus outbreak that has killed more than 3… [+4537 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China coronavirus deaths, infections jump: All the latest updates
articles.description: The death toll from the still-unknown virus continues to rise as more countries restrict China travel.
articles.content:
The death toll from China's coronavirus outbreak has jumped to 304, the government said on Sunday, as foreign nations imposed extraordinary travel restrictions on China, and airlines suspended flights.
At least 304 people in China were confirmed dead in the … [+1020 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China coronavirus toll reaches 304, number of cases hits 14,380
articles.description: Latest deaths all took place in central Hubei province; the epicentre of the outbreak.
articles.content:
China said the number of people who have died from the coronavirus that originated in Wuhan late last year has now reached 304.
The number of confirmed cases rose to 14,380 as of the end of February 1, state television reported on Sunday.
More to come...
